5.eng-name: Establishing the Prayer and the Sunnah Regarding Them

hadiths.text: It was narrated that ‘Imran bin Husain said:“The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said the Salam after three Rak’ah for ‘Asr, then he stood up and went into the apartment. Khirbaq, a man with big hands, stood up and called out: ‘O Messenger of Allah! Has the prayer been shortened?’ He came out angrily, dragging his lower garment, and asked about it, and was told (what had happened). So he performed the Rak’ah that he had omitted, then he said the Salam, then he prostrated twice and said the Salam again.”

chapter.ara-name: باب فِيمَنْ سَلَّمَ مِنْ ثِنْتَيْنِ أَوْ ثَلاَثٍ سَاهِيًا
chapter.eng-name: One who says the Salam after two or three Rak’ah by mistake
